isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - TOP COVER ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Use Loctite Master Gasket Sealant #5699 and a sealant dispenser to put a new 3 mm (1/8 inch) sealant pattern for the top cover of the case. Refer to INSTALLING THE SEALANT section (Figure 355).

figure.caption: Figure 355. Eight Holes Surrounded by Sealant

note.para: If the top cover is difficult to install, remove the slave valve and the interlock pin from the main case.

step1.para: Install the top cover. Makes sure the cover is in the NEUTRAL position. Make sure the forks on the cover engage the collars in the transmission case ( Figure 356).
Install the mounting bolts and washers for the top cover. Tighten the bolts 34 to 47 Nm (25 to 35 ft-lbs.).
Install a detent ball in each of the three holes in the top cover (Figure 357).

note.para: Replace the detent springs as a set. Use the "yellow" spring in all the holes.
If a heavy-duty detent spring is used, install the spring (different color) in the bore on the slave valve side of the transmission.

step1.para: Install a spring on top of each detent ball in the holes in the top cover ( Figure 357).

figure.caption: Figure 357. Install Detent Balls and Springs
